msIdentifier.repository: The John Rylands Research Institute and Library

msContents.summary: Fragment of the Qurʾān on thick parchment and in large Kufi characters. Probably compiled from leaves from various old codices.

msItem.title: al-Qurʾān
القران
msItem.note: It is probable that the leaves which form the manuscript are taken from various old manuscripts. The writing is not the same and the number of lines is not identical in all the pages.

msItem.title: Sūrat al-ʾAʿrāf
سورة الاعارف
msItem.note: Sūrah 7:146-147 from بانهم to يعملو[ن].

msItem.title: Sūrat Yusuf
سورة يوسف
msItem.note: Sūrah 12:38-39 from نشرك بالله to الله ا[لوحد].

msItem.title: Sūrat Maryam
سورة مربم
msItem.note: Sūrah 19:9-15 from ولم تك to ولد ويوم.

msItem.title: Sūrat Ṭā Hā
سورة طه
msItem.note: Sūrah 20:121-125 from يخصفان to قال ر[ب] .

msItem.title: Sūrat Ṭā Hā
سورة طه
msItem.note: Sūrah 20:128-130 from يمشون to فسبح واضر[اف].

msItem.title: Sūrah 20:135-Sūrah 21:1-2
msItem.note: From ا فستعلمون to [ربهم محد[ث.
Last two lines on folio 6a in gold marks the beginning of new sūrah: سورة اقترب مائة واحدي عشرة اية (Sūrah Iqtaraba 112 verses). According to Mingana, these lines were added by a later hand.

msItem.title: Sūrat al-Muʿminūm
سورة المومنون
msItem.note: Sūrah 23:56-58 from نسارع to بايت.

msItem.title: Sūrat al-Muʿminūm
سورة المومنون
msItem.note: Sūrah 23:58-74 from يومنون to لنكبون.

msItem.title: Sūrat al-Furqān
سورة الفرقان
msItem.note: Sūrah 25:52-65 from الا كفورا to اصرف.

msItem.title: Sūrat al-Furqān
سورة الفرقان
msItem.note: Sūrah 25:68-70 from ا]لها] to فاوليك.

msItem.title: Sūrat ash-Shuʿarāʾ
سورة الشعراء
msItem.note: Sūrah 26:41-45 from اين to فالقي مو[سي].

msItem.title: Sūrat ash-Shuʿarāʾ
سورة الشعراء
msItem.note: Sūrah 26:72-77 from اذ تدعون to رب العا[مين].

msItem.title: Sūrat al-ʿAnkabūt
سورة العنكبوت
msItem.note: Sūrah 29:67-68 from يروا to في جهنم.

msItem.title: Sūrat ar-Rūm
سورة الروم
msItem.note: Sūrah 30:13-15 from بشر]كايهم] to الاخر[ة].

msItem.title: Sūrat ar-Rūm
سورة الروم
msItem.note: Sūrah 30:19-21 from الحي to لتسكنوا ا[ليها].

msItem.title: Sūrat ar-Rūm
سورة الروم
msItem.note: Sūrah 30:48-50 from اذا to علي كل.

msItem.title: Sūrat ar-Rūm
سورة الروم
msItem.note: Sūrah 30:56-58 from فهذا to ليقولن الذ[ين].

msItem.title: Sūrat Luqmān
سورة لقمان
msItem.note: Sūrah 31:16-17 from يبني to بالمعروف.

msItem.title: Sūrat az-Zukhruf
سورة الزخرف
msItem.note: Sūrah 43:54-58 from كانو]ا ما فسقين] to مريم مثلا.

supportDesc.foliation: Modern pencil foliation in Arabic numerals. On folio 7a, remains of an old foliation in ink: نهم , meaning 'ninth' in Persian.

layoutDesc.layout: Number of written lines is not identical. The first two pages have 5 lines to the page, then follow six pages of seven lines each. The remaining pages consists of six lines each.

handDesc.handNote: Kufi script. The diacritical points which are in form of perpendicular strokes sloping to the left are due to a later hand. The vowel points, which seem also to point to a different scribe, are in red, green and yellow.

decoDesc.decoNote: The points of separation of verses are marked by small arabesques of golden strokes.
The points which mark larger divisions are represented by various ornaments of gold letters: folios 3a, 4b, 8a, 11a, 13a, 16a, 19a, 23b,

history.provenance: Folios 1a, 2b and 4a are marked with inscriptions dated AH 1115 (1703 CE) and AH 1128 (1715 CE) by a certain Rajab ʿAlī, the owner of the manuscript, and with his official seal.

provenance.p: Formerly in the collection of Alexander Lindsay, 25th Earl of Crawford (1812–1880). His bookplace on the back pastedown.
Purchased by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1901 from James Ludovic Lindsay, 26th Earl of Crawford (1847–1913) .

acquisition.p: Bequeathed by Enriqueta Rylands (1843–1908) in 1908 to The John Rylands Library.

recordHist.source: Description based on A. Mingana, Catalogue of the Arabic Manuscripts in the John Rylands Library Manchester (Manchester: Manchester University Press, 1934).

availability.p: The item is available for consultation by any accredited reader.
For information on eligibility and admissions procedures, see Using Special Collections at the John Rylands Research Institute and Library.
For further information on the availability of the item, please contact the Special Collections Reader Services.
